title: Conversion therapy? It must be banned. I should know

title: Sir Keir Starmer promises to 'fix unprecedented stagnation' as Labour targets business voters
description: The leader will launch the party's "plan for business" on Thursday in front of hundreds of firms in central London.

title: Labour is ‘party of business’, Starmer to tell company chiefs
description: The Labour leader and shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves will seek to woo senior company executives and investors at event in London.

description: Rhun ap Iorwerth fears a potential future Labour government would not hand powers to the Senedd that the people of Wales want to see.

title: Keir Starmer 'disinterested' in Wales, claims Plaid Cymru leader
description: The leader of Plaid Cymru has accused Sir Keir Starmer of being “disinterested” in Wales, calling for Labour to be serious about delivering constitutional change if it comes to power.

title: PMQs: Keir Starmer says mortgages have increased by an average £240 a month – video
description: The Labour leader has challenged the prime minister on rising mortgage rates across the UK

title: Tilehurst residents share their worries with Keir Starmer
description: On the positive sides, Chris, along with friends Stanley and Sandy, said there was much community spirit in Tilehurst. As a group they often meet to “put the world to rights” at the cafe. “We have a good old natter, we help each other out with issues, we talk about anything,” she said.

title: UK opposition Labour party pledge productivity fix in latest pitch to business
description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will pledge to fix Britain's stagnating productivity at a conference for businesses on Thursday, its latest charm offensive to companies and investors ahead of a national election expected this year.

title: 'They're saying our daughters' lives worth less than those killed on streets - they deserve justice'
description: Justice for our Daughters – to help the bid to stop domestic violence killers being jailed for a decade less than other murderers

title: “Disgusting cowards!” Labour-run London council disrupted over Gaza
description: The protesters say party leader Keir Starmer justifying Israel’s collective punishment of two million Palestinians, and Labour’s refusals to call for a ceasefire in Gaza, will cost them at the next election.

title: Labour pledges to push ahead with renationalising rail as Starmer launches drive to woo business
description: Shadow transport secretary says no compensation will be paid to operators when contracts lapse and network goes into public ownership

title: Labour is ‘party of business’, Starmer to tell company chiefs
description: Sir Keir Starmer is set to pitch Labour as the party to reverse the UK’s slagging growth rates with a major address to hundreds of business leaders.

title: Fly-tipping three times more likely in Labour-run towns new data shows
description: Labour-run councils reported a shocking average of 6,843 fly-tipping incidents as opposed to 2,428 in Tory councils.

title: Nicola Sturgeon loses reputation and SNP votes after Covid ‘betrayal’
description: Labour hopes to take a number of seats from Humza Yousaf’s party in this year’s general election, after being left with one in 2019

title: Hunt: Less scope for tax cuts in March Budget than in the autumn
description: Jeremy Hunt said it is unlikely he will have “the kind of room that I had for those very big tax cuts” in the autumn statement. The Chancellor confirmed that he warned the Cabinet there is less scope for tax reductions in his March 6 Budget despite clamour within the Tory ranks for cuts to try to woo voters.
